Description: Rim sherd of North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl; cream slip. Interior: meander between lines at lip, lotus flower and bud frieze below with worn added red; exterior: meander between lines at rim; black-figure frieze of animals to left below: sphinx (front part lost) followed by lion (head and raised paw); much added red for details; rosettes, crosses and dots as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: GR 1924,1201,235, 943-949 and 971 probably all belong to the same bowl, with some doubt about 948a; on the inside it has key maeander at the rim above lotus and bud frieze; there are two goat friezes below. Outside has key maeander at rim, black-figure animals in handle zone, and two goat friezes below, above a lotus band near the foot. On 948a there appears the only goat with reversed head.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.208)
